docs.lead_paragraph: Brushing aside reports of rising premiums and concerns expressed by insurers, officials said there was widespread desire for coverage under the law.

headline.main: Affordable Care Act Plans Get 1 Million New Subscribers
headline.print_headline: Health Plan Enrollments Surge as a Deadline Nears

docs.abstract: Obama administration releases data on Affordable Care Act's third open-enrollment season, reporting that more than one million new customers have joined program.

docs.lead_paragraph: A provision slipped into a 2014 spending law by the Florida senator has tangled up the Obama administration and sent tremors through health insurance markets.

headline.main: Marco Rubio Quietly Undermines Affordable Care Act
headline.print_headline: Rubio Measure Delivers a Blow to Health Law

docs.abstract: Largely ignored provision included by Sen Marco Rubio in spending law in 2014 has rattle health insurance markets and raised questions about durability of Affordable Care Act, making Rubio sole Republican presidential candidate who has made progress on Republican goal of dismantling law; provision took aim at so-called risk corridors and limited amount of money government can use to protect insurance companies from financial losses, which has already led some insurers to shut down.
docs.snippet: A provision slipped into a 2014 spending law by the Florida senator has tangled up the Obama administration and sent tremors through health insurance markets.

docs.lead_paragraph: The leaders of a Senate panel are condemning four companies for aggressively increasing prices for prescription drugs. They say the companies have exploited a system lacking in competition to hike prices for critically needed medicines.

docs.lead_paragraph: This story has a chance of ending happily. But it begins last fall in a mangy downtown apartment as Katy Yeager, seven months pregnant, stares at a syringe and the crumpled foil that holds $40 worth of heroin.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential hopeful Ben Carson wants to raise the Medicare eligibility age to 70 as part of a health care plan released Wednesday that would reshape the popular program for the nation's elderly in addition to overhauling Medicaid and repealing President Barack Obama's health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite important policy changes, transgender people continue to face barriers to affordable, critical medical care.

headline.main: No Reason to Exclude Transgender Medical Care

docs.abstract: Editorial urges insurance industry and public policymakers to follow medical establishment in deeming transition-related health care for transgender people medically necessary; cites research showing transgender people are healthier and more productive after transitioning with appropriate medical care  (Series: Transgender Today).
docs.snippet: Despite important policy changes, transgender people continue to face barriers to affordable, critical medical care.
